title: Corporate Governance Practices of Otis Worldwide Corp

content.text: The board of directors of Otis Worldwide Corp consists of highly experienced individuals with diverse backgrounds. The board comprises a mix of independent directors and executives, ensuring a balanced approach to decision-making. This composition brings different perspectives and expertise to the table, enabling effective oversight and strategic guidance.

Otis Worldwide Corp emphasizes the importance of independent directors on its board. It has established various committees, including audit, compensation, and nominating and corporate governance committees. These committees function with independent directors to ensure proper oversight on key matters and the implementation of best practices.

Otis Worldwide Corp follows a performance-based executive compensation system. The company aligns executive pay with the long-term interests of shareholders, linking it to financial performance metrics and strategic goals. This approach incentivizes executives to drive sustainable growth and shareholder value while avoiding excessive risk-taking.

Otis Worldwide Corp actively engages with its shareholders and values their input. The company conducts regular shareholder meetings, providing an avenue for open dialogue and addressing concerns. This approach promotes transparency and accountability to shareholders' interests.

Otis Worldwide Corp recognizes the significance of effective risk management. The board oversees the implementation of robust risk management practices to identify, assess, and mitigate risks. It ensures that appropriate measures are in place to safeguard the interests of stakeholders and protect the company's reputation.

Otis Worldwide Corp values ethics and compliance in its corporate culture. The company maintains a code of conduct and ethical standards framework that guides the behavior of its employees and executives. This commitment to ethical practices promotes trust and integrity within and outside the organization.

Otis Worldwide Corp prioritizes disclosure and transparency in its operations. The company provides timely and comprehensive information to shareholders and stakeholders, ensuring they have access to relevant data for making informed decisions. This commitment enhances trust and fosters responsible corporate behavior.

Otis Worldwide Corp demonstrates strong corporate governance practices. Its board composition promotes diversity and expertise, while the emphasis on independence ensures effective oversight. The performance-based executive compensation system aligns management incentives with long-term shareholder value. The company's engagement with shareholders, robust risk management, ethical standards, and transparency further enhance its governance framework.

news.headline: Otis to return $8 billion to shareholders via dividends and buybacks, CEO says
news.summary: Yahoo Finance Executive Editor Brian Sozzi is joined by Otis Worldwide (OTIS) CEO Judy Marks on the floor of the New York Stock Exchange to discuss the escalator and elevator operator's full-year guidance and expected sales growth, as well as Otis' position amid US inflation and Marks' own journey as an executive leader. "We still see healthy project flow. We came into the year with a new equipment backlog up 2% and a modernization backlog for refurbishment up almost 15%. A lot of that is happening here in North America," Marks says. "We've got the backlog that gives us that line of sight for our 2024 guide that lets us know what our revenue's going to be globally, not just here in the US." For more expert insight and the latest market action, click here to watch this full episode of Yahoo Finance Live. Editor's note: This article was written by Luke Carberry Mogan.
